subject: p17340686
History: Chest pain and recent tunneled line in right for dialysis. Evaluate line placement as well as a pneumonia versus effusion.
Findings: A right-sided tunneled dialysis catheter terminates in the right atrium. The cardiac silhouette is enlarged. There is redemonstration of peribronchial cuffing and increased interstitial markings, likely secondary to pulmonary edema. Increased bilateral lung opacities refelct growing nodules. There is a new region of consolidation above the minor fissure which could refelct an early infectious process.
Impression: Right-sided tunnel dialysis catheter terminates in the right atrium. Increased bilateral lung opacities reflect growing nodules. New region of consolidation above the minor fissure is concerning for an acute infectious process. Short interval followup recommended.
